intro: Bulbinella hookeri, commonly known as the rock lily, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its compact, succulent-like appearance. The plant produces small, delicate flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple, often blooming in spring. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is well adapted to arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
